messageBody:
> On the other hand, your comment made me realize that perhaps test
> methods in a TestCase could share a fixture by storing that fixture in
> static variables. If the fixture includes an expensive database
> connection, for example, could that connection not be created by the
> first test method and stored in a static variable for all subsequent
> test methods to share? Not sure how you could close the connection at
> the end of the last test method executed, though. Has anyone used
> static variables to share fixture objects among multiple test methods?

I use this technique with a ResourceManager. To close the connection, you could
work with a TestSetup.tearDown method on the TestSuite level but it's getting a
little bit messy IMO. But since JUnit was not designed to share resources,
tricking JUnit to share them is going to be messy anyway.

-Vladimir
